dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's vote on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will one more vote satisfy you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it'll satisfy me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. What is it you're proposing, Mister McMurphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proposing a re-vote on watchin' the ballgame!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the patients) A vote is before the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I wanna see the hands. I wanna see which of you birds has any guts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in favor of changing the schedule raise his hand. The first hand to come up is Cheswick's. Then McMurphy's. Then Martini, Scanlon, Sefelt, Fredrickson, Billy and Tab Harding doesn't vote. Big Nurse starts counting the hands. McMurphy, his face beaming, counts the hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it! We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, I count only eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there are eighteen patients on the ward, Mister McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the light dawning) You mean to tell me you're gonna count those old birds over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mister McMurphy, but you must have a majority to change ward policy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be a son-of-a-bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B-But, M-M-Miss R-Ratched, y-you n never c-c-counted th-their votes before! A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing ground) You mean you don't want their votes to count, Billy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, screw that noise! McMurphy rises and, taking his chair, he crosses toward t television set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mister McMurphy! McMurphy turns the TV on, flips the channel, then sits an waits for a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to turn the television off and return to your place! A picture swirls onto the TV screen. The ballgame is in progress (documentary footage to be used). Martini rushes over and joins McMurphy. Scanlon follows h on his heels as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoo-wee! Man, all I need me now is a can of beer and a red-hot. Cheswick gets up and starts across when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mister Cheswick. Cheswick stops and stands there, helpless to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack... McMurphy is deep into the game.

dialogues.speaker: TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: On the screen a great play is taking place, and at the breathtaking moment the TV picture swirls into a little e of light -- then nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The Acutes are left with their mouths hanging open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) I want you men to return to your proper places. The group meeting is not over! McMurphy continues looking at the blank TV screen as the Acutes look from McMurphy to Big Nurse, not knowing what do next when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up and shouting at the blank TV screen) A hit! It's a hit! He's rounding first, heading for second. Here comes the throw. He's sliding... and... he's safe! He's safe! (McMurphy whistles and claps his hands) Hoo-wee! Whatta game! Whatta game! Come on, Koufax! Strike 'em out! The Acutes are stunned at McMurphy's outburst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) Mister McMurphy, you are deliberately violating the rules!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's into his wind-up. Here comes the pitch. Strike on the inside corner! Sefelt, Fredrickson, Billy and Taber get up and cross tow the TV. Harding is the only one who doesn't join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) You men remain seated!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (focusing in on TV screen) He's into his wind-up. Here's the next pitch... and it's a hit! It's a hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up and down) I saw thum! I saw thum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too! Me, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I see it! I see it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his feet, shouting) Ya-hoo, let's'play ball! The other Acutes pick up on McMurphy and start shouting a the blank TV screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya-hoo!  It's a hit!  A triple!  It's a home run!  A double!  He's out!  Whadaya blind?  He's safe by a mile!  (AD LIB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) You boys, stop this and go to your assignments! Mister McMurphy, I want you to set an example...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay, it's two outs, bases loaded as Koufax steps up to the mound... Checks the runners... goes into his wind-up... Here comes the three-two pitch... And it's a fly ball into deep center. Mantle is going back. He's going back! Back! His back is up against the wall... and... he catches it! He catches it! The Acutes are shouting, cheering, stomping and dancing i each other's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over loudspeaker) You men stop this! Mister Washington! Miller! Warren! Big Nurse's last words overload the intercom and the syst peaks out. Big Nurse's mouth continues to work in frantic circles as Washington, Miller and Warren rush to quell th uproar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Spivey is seated behind his desk, looking over McMurphy's papers. McMurphy sits facing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine, Doc... In fact, I think I might've put on a couple of pounds since I got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good, and how are you getting along on the ward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Doc, you know as well as I do what's been comin' down in that loony bin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well, Miss Ratched feels that you're a disturbing influence on the other patients.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot, Doc, the only one I'm disturbing is that old nurse and her fixed ways. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that may be so, but in making a careful study of your past record, along with your behavior since you arrived here, my feeling is that you are not mentally ill and it is going to be my recommendation that you be returned to Pendleton where they are better equipped to handle your case. This is the kiss of death to McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Doc, you must be kiddin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that old nurse sure wants my ass in a sling, don't she!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mister McMurphy, it's just that we cannot offer you the guidance and assistance that you would receive at Pendleton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guidance and assistance! That's insane! Doc, ya gotta help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I can't keep you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll let you know. REACTION SHOT of McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washington and Warren are sitting on the grass watching Martini, Scanlon, Harding and Billy, who are positioned o the court waiting on McMurphy who is under the board with Bromden. Cheswick and the other patients hang around off court as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great physical and vocal emphasis throughout entire scene) Okay, Chief. This is your spot! I don't want you to move from this spot! Never!... 'Kay, now, take the ball! Raise your hands, like this... McMurphy raises his hands above his head. Bromden follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good! That's a good boy, Chief! Now jump and put it in! McMurphy jumps. Bromden doesn't. McMurphy does this a cou of times. Each time Bromden remains motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, goddammit! You don't have ta tell me that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you talking to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talkin' to him! I'm talkin' to myself! It helps me think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it doesn't hurt him either! (turning to Bromden) Does it, Chief! (no response) See, it doesn't hurt him. (to Bromden) Jump! An' put it in! McMurphy jumps. Bromden doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think you're just confusing him... Bromden jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Did ya see that! (calling to Cheswick on the sidelines) Hey, Cheswick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here! Cheswick runs over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get on your shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mack... McMurphy climbs on his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay, wheel me around to the basket... 'Kay, easy, easy. Hold it! 'Kay, now. (he sees Bromden has walked away) Hey, Chief, come back! Bromden doesn't hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheswick, go get 'im! Cheswick goes after Bromden, catches him, and McMurphy latches onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, wheel me to the basket. Cheswick, straining under the weight of McMurphy, turns toward the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bromden, chewing his gum, watches McMurphy ease his wa out of bed and silently cross down the aisle, past the sl patients, toward the day room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy crosses the day room, past the nurses' statio where Turkle is asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy crosses down the hallway and stops at the mes hall door. He tries the handle. The door is locked. McMur looks up at the open transom, ponders it, then jumps up a grabs the door lintel. He tries to lift himself up, but c make it when suddenly he is lifted up to the level of the transom by Bromden. McMurphy worms his way through the transom and disappears down the other side. CAMERA HOLDS on Bromden who waits. A long beat. There is strange HUMMING SOUND HEARD O.S. Another beat, then the d opens. McMurphy smiles at Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the floor) Wait here, Chief. (more to himself as he starts down hall) Heh, heh, I'll show 'em who's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy is nudging Cheswick awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Cheswick! Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) Yeah, Mack, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. Goodbye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Where ya goin', Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... McMurphy turns and crosses to Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking Billy) Hey, Billy. Billy boy, wake up and say goodbye to your ol' buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) W-w-w-what is it, M-M-Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-wh-wh-wh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... McMurphy turns from the bewildered Billy and crosses to Martini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nudging Martini awake) Psst! Hey, Martini, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) Yeah, Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye. McMurphy turns to Scanlon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scanlon! Hey, Scanlon, wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) Yeah, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. See ya around the ball park. McMurphy crosses to Fredrickson and wakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) What? What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Freddy. Don't take any wooden nickles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... The other patients are sitting up, some of them getting o of bed as McMurphy turns to Sefelt who is snoring. McMurp pinches his nose and Sefelt wakes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye, pussy cat. McMurphy crosses to Taber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking Taber) Up an' at 'em, Taber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Time to say goodbye. McMurphy turns and crosses to Harding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hard-on. Wake up, Dumbo. Harding opens his eyes and looks at McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya owe me twenty-five bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busting outta this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Send me a post card. Harding turns his back to McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to the others who have gathered around) So long suckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-wh-where ya going, M-M-Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How ya gettin' out, Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... That's for me to know an' you to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You ain't got no way out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much ya wanna bet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on. (to the others) Let's go! An' keep it quiet. McMurphy starts down the aisle. The others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy and the other patients cross the day room, pa the nurses' station, where Turkle shifts in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy and the patients cross down the hallway and e the mess hall followed by Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheswick, Bromden, Martini, Scanlon, Sefelt, Fredrickson, Billy, Taber and McMurphy, stand looking at the dumbwaite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-wh-what's d-d-down th-there, M-M Mac?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out. It's the way out. So just keep it in your minds if ya ever wanna make use of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna see it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too! Me too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-y-yeah, p-p-prove it, M-M-Mac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, show us, Mac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Wait a minute. You guys are gonna screw up my plans. So just gone on back to bed like nothin' happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I wanna go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too! Me too! Several of the others chime in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Hold it down! I'll take you guys down, but ya gotta come right back up! 'Kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) 'Kay, Mac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... Remember this is a privilege, so I don't want none of you goons fuckin' up. Kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) 'Kay, Mac!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay, let's see... (he checks the men out) Cheswick first ... then Billy... Martini... Scanlon... Sefelt... Fredrickson... Taber an' the Chief... 'Kay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) 'Kay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are waiting in the tunnel, which is used as underground connecting system to the institutional buildi as McMurphy gets out of the dumbwaiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Where's Martini and Scanlon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) They went that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie, ya can't ever let those goons outta ya sight! Understand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Mack! Far down the tunnel Martini and Scanlon are briefly SEEN they skitter across the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Martini! Psst! Scanlon! Ya dumb goons, come back here! (starting after them) Come on, let's get 'em! McMurphy starts down the tunnel. The others don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back) Come on, you guys, let's stick together. The Acutes follow McMurphy. They run down to the intersec and turn the corner. No sign of Martini or Scanlon. Somewhere a DOOR is HEARD SLAMMING CLOSED and FOOTSTEPS a HEARD coming their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh! (he listens then) This way! McMurphy hustles the men round the corner as two aides pushing a gurney come wheeling by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I th-th-think we sh-sh-should go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my feet are gettin' cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll go back just as soon as we find those guys! 'Kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) 'Kay, Mack! The band takes off down tbe tunnel, calling out in loud whispers, "Martini! Scanlon! Psst! Where are you?" Down one tunnel and up another -- till they turn a corner see an open door. They go to the door and peer out. Steps lead up to the outside world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must be up there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L-L-Let-'s go b-back! Several Acutes express the same desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't crap out on me now. We got two buddies out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I d-d-don't know! M-M-Miss R Ratched g-g-g-g...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Miss Ratched! McMurphy crosses out and up the stairs. The Acutes look at each other. A beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! Look at this! The Acutes don't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys, come on up here and take a gander at this! The Acutes inch their way out the door and up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Acutes join McMurphy to see the moon low in the sk silhouetting the trees and buildings, and Martini chasing Scanlon across the wet grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his attention elsewhere) Hey, what's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneously) What? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squinting) I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-i-it's a b-b-bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y-y-yes, a b-b-bus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shoot, man! Whadaya say we take ourselves a little spin around the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe we ought to go back, Mac...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my feet are cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My feet hurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I'm w-w-wet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking towards the bus) Go ahead! Go back! The Acutes cast frightened looks at each other then go af McMurphy. Martini and Scanlon join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-H-How d-d-do we g-g-get b-back? McMurphy has reached the bus and begins checking it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take us back to the dumbwaiter, Mac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back in there. I told ya this was a one way trip. Now stand aside. McMurphy lifts the hood to the bus and begins jumping the wire. The Acutes stand helplessly by as the engine turns and catches. McMurphy closes the hood and gets on the bus a chorus of, "Please, Mac, take us back... Please..." McMurphy puts the bus in gear and the bus starts moving. Acutes start running alongside of the bus calling out for McMurphy to take them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to them) Get on assholes! They leap on.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: As the bus makes a full circle and stops alongside of Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving Bromden onto the bus) Come on, Chief! Let's go! Bromden boards the bus. McMurphy lets out a war whoop as closes the door and starts the bus moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the bus picks up speed and churns across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Acutes look out with wild-eyed excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the bus careens out the main entrance and down the thoroughfare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Acutes cast worried looks at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the bus turns a corner past a sign that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy is singing at the top of his lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Your horses are hungry, That's what she did say, Come sit down beside me, An' feed them some hay. My horses ain't hungry, They wontt eat your hay-ay-aeee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-Hey, M-Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-W-Where we g-g-going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Where do ya wanna go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's cold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll miss breakfast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast! Hell, I know just the place where we can chow down an' thaw out before we shoot back on home. 'Kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'K-Kay, M-Mack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) Soo, fare-the-weel, darlin'. I'm gone on my way, My wagons are loaded, My whip's in my hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dawn is just cracking the horizon as the bus pulls up behind a corroded tin sheet building. A sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: DEPOE BAY, SEAMANIS SERVICE, SPORT FISHING, BOATS FOR CHA
dialogues.text: Beyond the boathouse is the dock with several fishing trawlers and beyond that -- the open sea. The door to the bus opens and McMurphy gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he steps out of the bus) This is it! as McMurphy walks directly to the wall, alongside the doo lifts the edge of the siding, comes up with a key, opens door and enters. A beat, then the lights go on inside the building.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF BUS
dialogues.text: The Acutes' faces pressed against the windows, looking ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy lifts a cold bottle of beer out of a Coca-Col cooler, opens it, takes a long pull on the bottle, then crosses to the heater and turns it on. Nearby, a sign reads: ALL EQUIPMENT CAN BE RENTED On the walls are old photographs of people with their pri catches. Fishing equipment, tackle and wet weather gear c the room. There is a counter which McMurphy walks behind and takes bag of potato chips off a wall rack, full of beer nuts, hostess cupcakes, etc. McMurphy eyes the keyboard to the fishing boats. Several are there.

dialogues.speaker: KEYBOARD
dialogues.text: with the names of the fishing boats: The Lark. Mary Ann. Noel. Annabella. The Capri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy studying the board as the Acutes stick their hea in the door. They're all miserable and cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in an' warm up. You can put some of that gear on to keep warm. An' there's beer an' Coke in the cooler an' some food over here... They hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't be shy now, you're among friends. The Acutes come in, Bromden bringing up the rear. Martini goes for the candy. Scanlon goes for the Coke. Se and Fredrickson go for the wet weather gear and boots. Th others go to the heater. Bromden stands in the middle of room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't one of you boys help ol' Chief there get warmed up? Billy goes to Bromden's aid as McMurphy crosses to a wind and looks out. McMurphy turns and looks out the window. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you think we'll be going back, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out the window) Come here a minute, Cheswick. You, too, Sefelt. Hey, all you guys, come over here, I wanna show you somethin'. The Acutes cross to the window and look out, saying, "Wha What is it? Whadaya lookin' at? I don't see a thing."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look at the pretty boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled against the dock is a trim fishing trawler, beautifully framed in the bay window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, did you ever see a boat like that? Why, I'll bet you could go all the way to Hawaii in that boat! Tahiti... the Philippines... Tibet... CAMERA HOLDS on FULL SHOT of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: A long beat, then we SEE the Acutes, wearing wet weather gear, complete with boots and squall hats, each man carry soda pop, food, fishing equipment, etc., being led onto t boat by McMurphy who carries a case of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a white gorge of smoke and water pours from the stern the boat pulls away from the dock, leaving a boiling foam water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire crew is jammed into the bridge, McMurphy behin the wheel. McMURPHY'S POV as the dock and other fishing boats slip by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the boat passes out of the harbor and heads for the op sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is up. The engine is dead. The ballgame is HEARD ship's RADIO. The men are scattered over the boat. Taber McMurphy, beer in hand, are sunning themselves, listening the ballgame. On the stern Martini and Scanlon are trying rig up a pole. Fredrickson gives them a hand. Billy has a line out. So does Bromden and Sefelt who is seated nearby fishing the ocean floor when he suddenly gets a bite and looks over the side, surprised. His line goes straight do into the depths. His glasses fall off into the water. Sef sighs and slowly begins reeling his line in. Billy gets a strike and starts fighting the fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-H-Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease up on the star drag, keep the tie up, up and work hell outta that fella. Martini gets a strike and loses it. Scanlon comes up and starts to take the pole from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging onto the pole) No. They start a tug of war. Fredrickson tries to break it up when he gets a strike and his line spins out. Billy's fish breaks into the sun in a shower of silver scales, and he gets so excited he lets the end of the pol down and the line snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up, I told you! Keep that tip up... up! You had you one big silver there. Fredrickson lands his salmon in a spray of scales and blo The fish is flopping all over the deck. Billy grabs the f and wrestles it down. Bromden lands a fish when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God! I see something! Everyone rushes over to Sefelt and looks down into the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep down in the water a gigantic white form slowly rises of the depths, becoming solid, alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll never get that on the boat. The fish is now clearly SEEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling) M-M-Mack! M-M-Mack! McMurphy pulls himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-C-Come here and l-look at th this! McMurphy crosses down and looks over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a big flounder. Could weigh two, three hundred. You got to lift him in with a winch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean we have to cut him loose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like hell we will! We got the muscle standing right here. All we need is a couple gaffin' hooks and some rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I'll get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. McMurphy turns to Sefelt who is sweating under the strain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steady does it, Sefelt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive fish is closer to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: All the men are standing by as gaffing hooks and rope are made ready. The fish is gaffed and slowly hauled out of t water. McMurphy and Bromden lean over, held by the others, grab big fish by its gills and, with a heave-ho, the fish is s in and flopped to the bottom of the boat. The men go sprawling over the big fish. There's a lot of laughter, handshakes and back-slapping going on when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over bull horn) All right! Stand to! Stand to! The men look up.

dialogues.speaker: ACUTES' POV
dialogues.text: Off the bow is a Coast Guard cutter, and on the deck stan Doctor Spivey, Washington, Warren and several other aides dressed in white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Acutes, sunburned and covered with dried brine and fish scales, are escorted down the hallway by Washington, Warren and Doctor Spivey. It's a triumphant procession as they wheel the giant flou with a sheet over it on a gurney, holding up their catche for all to see. McMurphy is lagging a bit behind as they pass the mess ha where workmen are busy installing a security screen over transom, while inside the mess hall another workman is SE welding a lock on the dumbwaiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Big Nurse steps out of the Nurses' Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Big Nurse) Here they are, Miss Ratched. Safe and sound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Well, boys, did you enjoy yourselves? A burst of exuberance as the inmates hold up their fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sefelt) Show her the one you caught, Jim. Sefelt whips the sheet off the big fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, my... No one can find superlatives or gestures big enough to describe his catching of the big fish, "brought it in himself" AD LIB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, ya should've come along with us, Miss Ratched, an' gotten a little sun on your cheeks and maybe caught a fish or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. McMurphy, you had no right to take these men out with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) Yeah, that's kind of crazy, ain't it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was irresponsible! Big Nurse turns to the others, leaving McMurphy dangling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (respectfully) That's quite a catch, Jim. Whaat are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to McMurphy) Gimme a cigarette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I might donate it to the mess hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaches in his pocket; he has none) I don't have any. AD LIBS: "They could use it." "Take a picture first."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an excellent idea. Now, why don't you boys place your fish on the gurney and we'll see to it that everyone enjoys a fresh fish dinner. The men toss their fish on the gurney as Martini joins th group and starts hitting the others up for a cigarette. A he gets for his troubles are a series of "No," "Get lost, don't have any."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, boys. Now if you'll just go along with Mister Washington to the showers, supper is in half an hour. The inmates start AD LIBBING and laughing, "We're not hungry," as Martini sees Harding light up a cigarette and crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harding) Gimme a cigarette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not running a charity ward... Martini snaps the cigarette out of Harding's hand, and ta off with Harding chasing him. Martini dashes around the room, pulling chairs in Harding way, taking a drag on the cigarette whenever he can. Harding corners Martini, but Martini tosses the cigarette over Harding's head to Scanlon. Scanlon takes off with Harding after him, absolutely livi Scanlon passes to Billy who passes to Martini. Everyone i the room is getting wired. Martini throws it away as Harding jumps him and nails him the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his hands up; empty) All gone! All gone! Don't hit! Don't hit! Harding starts pounding Martini's head on the floor when Billy and Scanlon jump Harding and start pounding him. Fredrickson picks up the cigarette and stands there watch the fight as he smokes the cigarette as Washington, Warre and Miller move in and start separating the men. McMurphy, watching the fight, sighs, then deliberately crosses toward the Nurses' Station.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: as McMurphy reaches the Nurses' Station and puts his hand through the plate glass window, his fist stopping inches Miss Pilbow's startled face. Miss Pilbow's scream is adde the SOUND OF THE SHATTERED WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy reaches in and picks up his carton of cigarettes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure sorry, ma'am. Gawd, but I am. That window glass was so clean I didn't even see it... McMurphy turns and crosses back to the day room, opening carton of cigarettes as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want cigarettes! Here's the goddamn cigarettes! McMurphy starts tossing packages of cigarettes into the m of struggling bodies as Washington grabs McMurphy by the and tries to wheel him away. McMurphy shakes him off and throws a pack of cigarettes i Washington's face. Washington goes after McMurphy, grabs him, and drives him against the wall, right next to Bromden, who watches as McMurphy shoves Washington away, goes into a crouch and starts circling Washington. Washington dances in and out, chipping away at McMurphy's face until McMurphy drives hi fist square into Washington's white, starched chest, draw him against the wall. McMurphy moves in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warren! Miller! The Acutes have stopped fighting and are watching. McMurphy tags Washington, then is grabbed from behind by Warren, who pulls him back. Washington moves in and goes to work on McMurphy, when Bromden grabs Washington, from behind, in a bear hug. Miller jumps on Bromden's back. Bromden, still holding Washington, backs up into the wall, squashing Miller, who screams out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy, bruised from the fight, and Bromden, handcuf to a special belt, wait while an aide unlocks the first o double set of heavy security doors. The first door is locked, leaving McMurphy, Bromden, and three aides crammed in the small space between the two do while another aide opens the second door and McMurphy and Bromden step through, followed by the aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the aide locks the door behind them, the other aides l Bromden and McMurphy toward a bench, where they unshackle them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to a bench) Wait over there... The three aides go down the hall, leaving McMurphy and Bromden who sit and look at their new surroundings. There a man sitting next to them. McMURPHY'S POV The architecture is the same as the ward we left below, b it is the atmosphere that is different. A heaviness perva all. Heavily sedated patients sit isolated from each othe Others stand shifting from one foot to the other, while others walk up and down the hallway, their locomotive pow not unlike that of Parkinson's Disease (caused by too muc sedation). Suddenly, one patient gets up, speaking very angrily, shouting incoherently at no one; he crosses the hall and enters a side room. An aide goes in after him. A long bea then the aide comes out with the patient and gently leads back to his seat, talking softly to the man. Further down the hallway, a gurney is wheeled out of the room with a patient lying on it, out cold; he is wheeled further down the hall to the men's dorms, where he is lef sleep it off. Two aides come out of the EST room and head in McMurphy's direction, where one of the aides motions to the patient sitting next to McMurpby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching him very gently) Come on, Joey... this isn't going to hurt you... good for you... make you feel better... The patient clings to the bench, terrified, weeping. The aides peel him off the bench and escort him down the to the EST room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As McMurphy watches the patient go, he takes out a packag gum. Takes a stick for himself and gives Bromden one. McMurphy turns back to his own thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. McMurphy looks up. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Another beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say... God Bless America!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God Bless America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping his thigh) Goddammit, you sly son-of-a-bitch! Does anybody else know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! This is too much! (his mind going a mile a minute) Chief, I tell you we're gonna bust outta this place an' make it all the way to Canada before they know what bit 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ca-na-da...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya like that, Chief, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, well, well. 'Bout time the rest of the world got a gander at Big Chief Bromden cuttin' down the boulevard, stopping just long enough for virgins... Oh, man, I tell you, I tell you, you'll have women trippin' you and beating you to the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ca-na-da...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, Chief, don't talk. Never talk! Remember, this is just between you an' me. Do ya understand? Bromden nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister McMurphy. McMurphy turns to see Nurse Itsu. The two aides are stand behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing a long-lost friend) Hey, how ya doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you. (offering pills) Here, please take these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help you relax... please... McMurphy takes the pills and downs them. Bromden takes hi pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take off your shoes. McMurphy takes off his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, thumbs up) You an' me, Chief. McMurphy, flanked by the two aides, follows Nurse Itsu to EST room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Itsu) You know, I never got your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping at the door) Miss Itsu. (indicating the room) In here, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You comin' in to hold my hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... Well, see ya around, Itsu. Itsu smiles at McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... McMurphy gives Bromden one last wave and goes in. Bromden watches the door close behind McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are four other aides in there, standing around an e gurney. A DOCTOR is at the head of the gurney, a NURSE alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Hi... McMurphy looks around at the six aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys can take a cigarette break now... The Nurse smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, Mister McMurphy, just climb on the bed and lie down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, Doc... McMurphy climbs on the bed and lies down. The Doctor moves around to the side of the bed and takes McMurphy's pulse, while the Nurse dips her fingers into a of salve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McMurphy) This won't hurt you at all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, uh... The Nurse starts applying salve to McMurphy's temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conductant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling up at her) Surely, goodness and mercy will follow this, eh, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding a mouthpiece) Please, put this in your mouth... McMurphy takes the bit in his teeth. The Doctor moves bac the head of the gurney and places the thongs on McMurphy' temples. The Doctor nods to the six aides, who move in and gently place their hands, in a very professional manner, on McMurphy's knees, hips and shoulders. Once set, the Docto turns to his controls. SHOT OF McMURPHY as he looks around, not nearly as scared as he is mystifi by the whole process, when suddenly, without warning, McMurphy is hit by the shock. His face is a contorted mas surprise and pain. His whole body caught in a sudden spas moment of rigidity, then McMurphy passes out and his body relaxes. Another moment, then a series of violent body sp begin flowing down his body. Now the aides' function is v clear, as they press down, holding McMurphy firmly to the gurney, until the last spasm subsides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Group Meeting is in progress. Doctor Spivey is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sefelt) It's been brought to my attention that you're giving Mister Fredrickson your medication, aren't you, Mister Sefelt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Dilantin that makes my gums soft!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Jim, you must be honest with yourself. At the end of the hall, the door opens and McMurphy and Bromden enter the visitors' room, accompanied by Washingt and Warren. They cross to the security gate, open it and into the hallway. Washington and Warren disappear into a room, leaving McMu and Bromden, who walk slowly towards the day room. The Group Meeting continues over as Fredrickson raises hi hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Fredrickson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna know why the dorm has to be locked in the daytime and on weekends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why can't a fellow even have the weekends to himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing up) Yeah, whadabout our cigarettes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Mister Cheswick, and wait your turn! He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the dorms were left open, you would just return to bed after breakfast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? Is it a mortal sin? I mean, normal people get to sleep late on weekends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With few exceptions, time spent in the company of others is therapeutic, while every minute spent brooding alone only increases separation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping up as he sees McMurphy) Mack! Everyone looks at McMurphy and Bromden. Bromden is as he always was, as McMurphy slowly drags him into the day room. He looks like a zombie as he takes the room in. Then, suddenly, he slaps his thigh. McMURPHY Hey, hey, you ding-a-lings, you creeps, you goons... He enters the room doing a jig. The Acutes' faces light u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got ten thousand watts and hot to trot. First woman takes me on is gonna light up like a pinball machine an' pay off in silver dollars... McMurphy does a full circle of the room, greeting the Chronics. But it's an effort for him. His voice is slower his footwork slightly out of sync.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-h-how's it g-g-going, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine, Billy boy, just fine. Full of piss an' vinegar! They checked my plugs and cleaned my points...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning) Yes, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope everything is settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, I'm as gentle as a puppy dog. Why, I haven't licked the tar out of an aide for two weeks! Hi ya, Doc! Spivey greets McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Why don't you join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you, ma'am... (he gets a seat and sits heavily) Whew. Man, I tell you, that place up there is somethin' else! (pulling it together) Well, ya boys been practicin' up for the big game? (no response) I figured as much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-W-We h-heard y-you w-were n-never c-c-coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, let me tell ya somethin'... While I was up there gettin' in-lightened, I came up with one hellava plan... A great sadness suddenly sweeps over McMurphy's face and breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh-wh-what p-plan, M-Mack! No response from McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your plan, Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming out of it) Plan?... Oh, yeah, the plan... Yeah... McMurphy gets up and crosses to the window, where he join Bromden who is looking out the window. REACTION SHOT of the others as they look at McMurphy and other with quizzical looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the court both teams are lined up taking photographs f the local newspaper. The bulb pops a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wrapping it up) Thank you, boys. The line breaks up. McMurphy crosses to Big Nurse, who si in the front row. It's the big Saturday game between the Acutes and Aides, spectators enter the gymnasium already half-filled with m and female patients, staff members and visitors. Doctor Spivey stands nearby at the timers' table, basketb in hand, whistle around his neck, talking to the timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Ratched, would you please save a space for my aunt? She's comin' down from Portland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly, Mister McMurphy, with pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am... O.S. the WHISTLE BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go now, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Good luck, Mister McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am. McMurphy crosses onto the court. Big Nurse watches him go

dialogues.speaker: BASKETBALL COURT
dialogues.text: Doctor Spivey is at half-court, basketball in hand as the players take up their positions: Washington faces McMurph for the jump at center. Harding and Billy are playing gua with Warren and Miller on them. Martini and Scanlon are i the forward position, with the two white Aides covering t The other Acutes sit on the bench as substitutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Washington) Hey, Sam, bet ya two bucks ya lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, man, tha' ain't even worth considerin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spivey) You're a witness, Doc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I didn't hear a thing! Let's play ball! Spivey checks the court, then blows the whistle as he tos the ball into the air. Washington taps the ball to Warren, who passes to Miller, hands off to Washington, who goes up for a layup. Two poi The Acutes haven't even moved from their spots. The scoreboard reads: AIDES 2 PATIENTS 0.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the ball out) Come on, wake up, you ding-a-lings. The game is on. The Acutes snap to and McMurphy passes the ball into Hard who fiercely dribbles down court, McMurphy running alongs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass the ball, Harding... (no pass) Don't hang onto it... (no response) Pass it, goddammit! Harding dribbles into the corner and finds himself bottle by two Aides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harding, here, over here! The ball is snagged from Harding's hands by an Aide, who passes it down court to another Aide, who turns and makes another basket. Scoreboard: AIDES 4 PATIENTS 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harding) Ya deaf! I said pass the ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about??? Everybody was covered!!! Everybody was covered!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was open! Come on, let's play ball! McMurphy and Harding turn to see Martini, down court, pas the ball into Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping his hands) Gimme tha' ball! Billy panics and hands the ball to Washington, who turns around and makes another basket. Score: AIDES 6 PATIENTS McMurphy and Harding run down court, McMurphy taking the away from Martini, who would like to bring it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Washington) What kind of crap is that???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' playin' the game, sucker... Washington chuckles and trots on down court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Martini) Get down there where ya belong, Martini. You, too, Scanlon. (tosses ball to Harding) You take it out, Harding! Harding takes the ball and passes it in to McMurphy, who turns and dribbles down court exactly like Harding did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running alongside McMurphy) Pass the ball! (no response) Pass it! (no response) Pass it! Pass it! I'm open, McMurphy, pass the ball! McMurphy stops dead in his tracks and flings the ball at Harding. The ball bounces off Harding's head and goes out bounds. The WHISTLE BLOWS. Harding spins a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harding, get back here! Harding turns to see the other team go by. They score ano basket. Score: AIDES 8 PATIENTS 0. Billy takes the ball and passes into McMurphy, who turns see CANDY enter the gym, with her friend, ROSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Candy. Candy, over here. (to Doctor Spivey) Hey, Doc, time out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing his whistle) Time out! McMurphy tosses the ball to Spivey, then crosses the cour Candy and Rose, who have had a couple of drinks on the wa down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack, you sonofabitch, you ol' fucker, how've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swinging her around in his arms) Terrific, baby, terrific! (to Rose) Hi ya doin', Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Mack! (looking around) Whoowe, Candy girl, are we in an insane asylum or ain't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Candy) How's your ass been holdin' up, honey? Candy pokes her ass at McMurphy. He gives it a squeeze. O a WHISTLE BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, girls, we're holding up the game! McMurphy leads the two ladies across the court. The entire gymnasium is riveted on the three of them. As reach Big Nurse:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Ratched, this is my Aunt Candy and her friend Rose... Greetings are exchanged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Ratched was kind enough to save you ladies a seat... The two ladies wedge themselves in next to Big Nurse. O.S the WHISTLE BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to ya at half time! McMurphy turns and crosses onto the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Sock it to 'em, kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking in the players) Are they all crazies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, just those guys dressed in white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, miss, it's the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you could've fooled me. On the court, McMurphy throws the ball to Martini. Martini throws the ball to McMurphy. McMurphy throws the ball back to Martini. Martini throws the ball into the stands. The WHISTLE BLOWS O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadaya doin', there's no one there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw 'em! I saw 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Mack, get back here! McMurphy turns to see the other team go by and score a basket. Billy passes the ball into MeMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the ball!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the ball) Okay, Martini. That's okay. Now you watch me. McMurphy dribbles the ball down the sideline. Stops. Goes into his routine of ball tricks: faking one way, the the other, over his head, under his legs, finally ending pass behind his back which goes straight into Washington' hands. Washington dribbles down court for an easy layup. Score: AIDES 10 PATIENTS 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spivey) Time out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing his whistle) Time out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting to Timer) Replacement coming in! Harding out! McMurphy crosses to Bromden, takes his hand, and leads hi onto the court and under the Acutes' basket, where he maneuvers him into the proper position. Then McMurphy rai his hands above his head and Bromden follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting back up court) Time in! (sees Harding still on court) Hold it! Time out! (to Harding) I said Harding out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refuse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casting a quick look at his wife) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the coach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just started!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come back later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking for another victim) Scanlon out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! McMurphy looks at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I-I-I'll g-g-g-go, M-M-Mack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy, thank you, Billy. Billy goes off and sits by Big Nurse. Now, the lineup on bench is Billy, Big Nurse, Candy and Rose. Spivey blows the whistle. Under the Aides' basket, Harding passes the ball into McMurphy, who dribbles to half court, takes his mark, and lobs the ball over the outstretched arms of the Aides rig into Bromden's waiting hands. Bromden turns and slams the ball into the basket. The crowd goes bananas. Score: AIDES 10 PATIENTS 2 Bromden walks in majestic dignity the full length of the court and takes up his position under the Aides' basket, while McMurphy and his teammates have been putting tremen pressure on the Aides, not allowing them to pass the ball As soon as McMurphy sees that Bromden is firmly set, hand held up, under the Aides' basket, McMurphy turns and runs down court, followed by the other Acutes, where they take their defensive position. Washington and the Aides easily bring the ball down court work themselves into position, and take a shot at the bas which Bromden swats aside. Each Aide gets a shot at the basket, and each time Bromde swats it aside; sending the last swat into McMurphy's wai hands. McMurphy dribbles the ball up court, where he runs into h pressure from Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off to the side of McMurphy) McMurphy, pass the ball! McMurphy passes the ball to Harding and cuts toward the basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he cuts past Harding) Harding, pass the ball! Harding ignores McMurphy, as he runs by, and throws the b to Bromden, who turns and slams the ball into the basket. The crowd goes bananas. Score: AIDES 10 PATIENTS 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the top of her lungs) Atta boy, Mack! (to Big Nurse) What's he in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss, it's a complicated case. It would take too long to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, he looks like hell! CHEERS are HEARD O.S. Candy turns back to the game. CAMERA HOLDS on Candy, Big Nurse and Billy, who is starin Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy) Billy, it's not polite to stare! Billy sinks back, thinks it over, then presses forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Candy) Miss! Candy looks at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving him a big smile) Hi... Billy sinks back in his seat. On the court, McMurphy dribbles down to half court where is stopped by Washington and Warren, who put the squeeze him. McMurphy turns and gives them his ass to contend wit then manages to throw the ball under his legs and Washington's legs. The ball rolls to Martini, who scoops up and throwing it wildly away, the ball ricochets off th backboard and goes in for two points. The crowd goes bananas. Score: AIDES 10 PATIENTS 6 Bromden starts striding down court when the Aides make a break past him, but miss their shot. McMurphy retrieves the ball as Bromden, not more than sev feet from his own basket, does an about-face and returns his basket where he turns to see McMurphy lob the ball fu court to Bromden, who catches the ball on one bounce, tur and slams the ball in for another basket. Score: AIDES 10 PATIENTS 8 The crowd goes bananas and Bromden turns and starts strid down the court when he sees McMurphy at the far end of th court yelling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling and gesturing) Run, Chief, run! Bromden gets the idea and starts loping down court abreas Washington, who is making another fast break towards his basket. Washington and Bromden go up together and Bromden swats t ball to Scanlon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling and gesturing) Run, Chief, run! Bromden starts running towards his own basket, Washington on his heels, when the ball is passed to him and he goes makes the point, but takes a bad spill, crashing head ove heels to the floor. The crowd gasps. The WHISTLE BLOWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Foul! As McMurphy charges across court and grabs Washington by shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathing in Washington's face) Ya fuckin' coon, you're not on the ward now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cool as a cucumber) Take you han's offa me! Spivey comes running, blowing his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Break it up, boys! (to Timer) Point counts. One free throw! McMurphy pushes Washington away and turns to Bromden, who being helped off the floor by Harding, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great shot, Chief! Ya okay? You're doin' great! They lead Bromden to the foul line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Washington as they line up at the foul line) We got your black ass now, Washington, wanna bet another twenty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way... Bromden takes the ball at the foul line. Sets himself up lobs the ball underhand. It goes in. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are asleep except for Bromden who sits on th edge of his bed watching McMurphy, his face pressed again the window, looking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching) What you boys doin' up at this ungodly time o' the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prayin', brother. Prayin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you boys finish it up an' climb back into your beds. 'Kay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay... The men slide into their beds and Turkle goes off, clucki to himself. A beat, then McMurphy rushes back to the window and looks out. McMURPHY'S POV Outside, in the dark, Candy and Rose are seen wandering around. REVERSE ANGLE - BROMDEN AND McMURPHY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are, Chief! McMurphy tries to get the girl's attention and fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they goin'? McMurphy takes off, towards the day room, followed by Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two of them cross into the day room heading for th window, Turkle sticks his head out of the nurses' station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you boys to go to bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flagging the girls) Our prayers have been answered, Turkle! Our prayers have been answered! McMURPHY'S POV as we SEE the girls coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell ya, there's an angel of mercy standing out there, Turkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah, brother, now get back in bed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come an' see. Turkle comes out of the nurses' station, leaving the side window open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to McMurphy) That angel of mercy, he ain't a she, is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You's better believe it, brother! Turkle reaches the window and sees the girls outside. CANDY and ROSE'S POV - THE MEN looking out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Turkle turns to McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah believe ya, brother. Ah believe ya!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Turkle aside; holds up $20 bill) Now, wouldn't you pray for twenty bucks, a bottle booze an' a piece of that angel cake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the $20 and reaching for his keys) Ah'm on my knees, brother, ah'm on my knees. Turkle unlocks the security screen and raises the window. McMurphy sticks his head out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (both slightly tipsy) Hiya, Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... Candy passes a heavy bag of bottles in. Then McMurphy and Turkle help her in. Her dress is above her thighs, her as visible as she swings over the windowsill and into McMurp arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew! Made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embracing Candy) Man, you look good 'nough to eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well you look like hell warmed over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pssst! Whadda 'bout me? Turkle turns to help Rose in, but she's not as easy to handle, being a good deal heavier and twice as plastered Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mac! Gimme a hand, will ya! McMurphy disengages himself from Candy and lends Turkle a hand. Rose is finally hauled into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggling; loud) Whew! Hiya, boys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh... let's move it away from the window... The group shifts a few feet as Turkle closes the window a locks the screen. McMurphy turns back to Candy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arms open) Come here, sugar... Candy moves into McMurphy's arms as Rose, straightening h dress, turns to see Bromden looming. Rose SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (backing into Turkle) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mystified) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Bromden) That!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that. That ain't nothin' to be afraid of, ma'am. Just ol Chief Bromden. That's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he one of the loonies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a patient, Rose...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching Bromden tentatively) Hi ya, big boy? How's it goin'? Like it in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear you, Rose. He's just a big deaf an' dumb indian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pssst! Hey Rose! There they are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) What? Where? CANDY points to the patients sleeping in the men's dorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! They're so quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sleeping, Miss. They're sleeping. An' we gotta keep it down so we don't disturb their sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they dangerous when they're awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, Miss. Not these loonies. These are nice guys. Nice guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells weird. Smells like pneumonia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ammonia, Miss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like piss. Is this real, Candy? Is this really real? I mean we are in an insane asylum, an' I wanna know how we got ourselves into this scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, please, Miss. Keep it down... Rose turns to McMurphy who has opened a bottle of booze a is taking a long pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McMurphy) Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing the bottle to Turkle) He's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing the bottle to Rose) Not exactly, Miss. Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drinking and passing the bottle to Candy) Yeah, well, I'll tell ya somethin'. I'll tell ya somethin'. I had this boyfriend, Chuck. (to McMurphy) Ya know him, Mac. Ya remember, Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I know Chuck. I know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, listen to this. He got mad at me one day. Boy, did he get mad at me. He took the light bulb, ya know. I thought he was going to cram it right up me, ya know. But he ate it. He ate the whole fucking light bulb. (to Turkle) Now, tell me! Is he crazy? Tell me! Is he crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Miss... I would say... I would say, yes. Yes, he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he in an asylum?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I see. He was a very sick man. Very sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I told his mother. And she said I was crazy. Her son ate the whole fucking light bulb and she said I was crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about that, Miss. I would have to examine you first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ol' fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm running a risk by letting you in, Miss. You know I'm runnin' a risk of gettin' my black ass fired. If you understand what I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, she understands what you mean. She's not dumb. Why do you think Rose came to visit us? Rose is very interested in hospitals and hospital facilities. Aren't you, Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be very glad to show you around, Miss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's a good idea, Turkle. Why don't ya take Rose on a little tour of our facilities...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Rose. You can go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Well if ya don't mind, I'll decide on my own date!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Rose! What's there to decide? There's only four of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddaya talkin' about? There's at least twenty guys in there. Let's wake 'em up and get this party on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Miss. What do you want with twenty zombies when you got a twenty gun salute looking you right in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better believe it, you sweet little thing. You better believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you sweet talk me you ol' spook, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm all through talkin'. Now, let's just you an' me trip on down that hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with him, Rose. Go with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, okay, but I just want to look at the facilities. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all I'm going to show you. McMURPHY'S POV - TURKLE AND ROSE as the two of them cross out of the day room toward the hallway, Turkle suddenly turns and hurries back to McMurp takes the bottle of booze and hurries off clucking to himself. BACK TO McMURPHY and CANDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Kay, lets get under way. McMurphy crosses to package of booze, selects another bot unscrews the top and takes a long pull, then hands the bo to Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the ol' hatch, Chief. Bromden takes a long pull on the bottle, gags and passes bottle to McMurphy who crosses to the nurses' station and peeks around the corner. McMURPHY as he peeks around the corner. McMURPHY'S POV - TURKLE AND ROSE far down the hallway, as Turkle shows Rose one room, then another, and then the seclusion room, into which Turkle playfully lures Rose, who playfully resists, but finally enters. A beat passes and they don't come out. BACK TO McMURPHY Satisfied, he crosses to the nurses' station, reaches in open side-door window, opens the door and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy enters the nurses' station and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are all asleep. A very long beat, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through loudspeaker; very low, ominous, drawn out) Who knows what evil lurks in the hearts of men... Ominous LAUGHTER, then the lights go flashing on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through loudspeaker) Medication time! Medication time! Rise and shine! Rise and shine! Time to say goodbye... Everybody up, up, up! Some of the patients immediately pop awake as Candy comes and starts hustling the patients out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and at 'em, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waking up) H-H-Hi, Candy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER as the patients are queued up at the nurses' station where Candy is handing out cups full of whiskey, McMurphy backing her up, pouring the booze into the cups. Harding takes his cup and moves back into the day room as Ellis automatically downs the booze, gags and goes spinni off across the hallway and is nailed to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: sticks his head out the door to check the scene out. Sees what's happening and comes rushing down the hallway, with his shirt, and zipping up his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Turkle shoves his way to the intercom system and switc off the lights and music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furiously pushing them out) You crazy goons... shut up an' get outta here... Out! Out! Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence as the last man is driven out of the nurses' stat Down the hallway, a light goes on in the visitors' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, it's the soo-per-visor come to fire my black ass. A KEY is HEARD hitting the lock at the end of the hallway Without losing a beat, Turkle reverses his movement and starts pushing everybody back into the nurses' station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing) Get back in there! In! In! In! As Turkle pushes the last man into the nurses' station, h sees Rose stick her head out of the seclusion room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning and shouting) Stay in there! Stay in there! Rose ducks back into the seclusion room as, simultaneousl Turkle closes the door behind him to the nurses' station the door to the ward opens and the NIGHT SUPERVISOR, a mi aged woman, enters the ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Turkle, shushing the crowd, makes his way to the nurse lounge and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh whisper) Alla ya goons, get in here! The patients pile into the nurses' lounge, Turkle crammin the last one through the door and closing it. He turns an crosses to the side door and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Turkle steps out of the nurses' station, closing the d behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there you are, Mister Turkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evenin', ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blocking her way to the day room) Why, sure, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights were flashing on and off, Mister Turkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jus' cleanin' up, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleanliness is a twenty-four-hour job, ma'am... Harding passes by and enters the latrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these men doing up wandering around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in) Ah guess the natives are restless, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting a whiff of his breath) You've been drinking on the job again, haven't you, Mister Turkle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, no, ma'am... well, yes, ma'am... (leaning in close) A man get awful lonely at night, if ya know what Ah mean, ma'am... Down the hall, Rose sticks her head out the door, sees wh happening, and ducks back in as the Night Supervisor turn her heel and starts back down the hallway, Turkle at her heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want those men put back to bed, Mister Turkle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you haven't heard the last of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am... She opens the gate, slams it behind her, crosses to the m door, opers it and exits to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Night, night. Turkle turns and the smile leaves his face as he hurries the hallway. O.S. the TOILET FLUSHES as Turkle stops at the seclusion and sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back, honey... Turkle closes the door, crosses down to the nurses' stati and enters as Harding comes out of the latrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
