dialogues.text: as Turkle enters, crosses to the nurses' lounge and opens door to see the patients, silhouetted against the open refrigerator light, moving around, pulling the room apart smacks of Dante's Inferno as Turkle snaps on the light an steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Turkle steps into the room and sees the extent of the plundering. The filing cabinet is open. So is the medicin cabinet. Rolls of medical gauze are strewn around, cough syrup and orange juice are flowing. The patients start piling out of the room, carrying their plunder. Fredrickson and Sefelt are SEEN sitting on the floor, in front of the open refrigerator, looking through their dossiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, they even got my first grade report card here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see... Sefelt leans in, unintentionally tipping a bottle of coug syrup in his hand which goes "glug, glug, glug..." all ov the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, they're terrible grades, Fred... Turkle stoically takes in the shattered remains of his jo unscrews the top to his bottle of whiskey, and takes the biggest swig of his life as, O.S., Rose is HEARD SCREAMIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rose, naked as the day she was born, runs screaming do the hall, Ellis loping after her, reaching out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the others, who are laying out food, drinking booze an stringing up hospital gauze, turn to see Rose enter the r She runs behind McMurphy, pressing her body to his, as he gently takes hold of Ellis' outstretched hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rose) Don't scream, honey... He gently guides Ellis to the wall, with Rose still cling to his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellis ain't gonna hurt you... Ellis is nice... Nice Ellis... see the nice lady... He pins Ellis to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, see, nice lady touch Ellis... Rose reaches out and touches Ellis. The others stand agog, looking at this Holy Trinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOFT NOSTALGIC NUMBER is HEARD OVER LOUDSPEAKER as Hard Billy and Cheswick watch McMurphy dance with Candy, Fredrickson with Sefelt and Rose, who is dressed, dance w Taber. Martini and Scanlon are busy draping hospital gauze aroun the room. Bromden sits by the window -- waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SOFT NOSTALGIC NUMBER is HEARD OVER LOUDSPEAKER a McMurphy, Candy, Harding, Cheswick, Taber, Sefelt and Fredrickson watch Rose, on a table, doing a solo bump-and grind dance, while Martini and Scanlon race around the ro in wheelchairs. Billy sits, watching Candy and McMurphy, who sit across t room. Candy is tired and bored. McMurphy is drunk and starting to fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to hit the road, Mack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping at her) Don't worry 'bout the road! We'll hit the road! It'll be there when we're ready! (to the room) Ain't that right, fellas? He gets up and crosses to his friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I jus' want you guys to have a good time... Are ya havin' a good time? You... you... good... good... Lez have some fun... He turns to see Billy, who isn't having fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsa matter with ya... Billy turns away and McMurphy crosses to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain'tcha havin' a good time... (no response) Whadaya want? Ya wanna drink? A cigarette... Billy looks up at McMurphy, his eyes are flooded with tea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatsamatter, kid, what's botherin' you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah-ah-ah-are y-y-y-you g-g-g-going t-t-t-to muh-muh-muh-marry her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-C-C-C-Candy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy? Hell no, Billy, she's just a good friend, that's all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wu-wu-wu I-I-I-I th-th-think sh-sh sh-she's th-th-th-the ma-ma-ma-most bu-bu-bu-beautiful wu-wu-wu-woman in th-th-the whole world! A long beat as McMurphy looks at Billy, then Candy, then Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Why don't ya go tell 'er... Billy doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, son, now's your chance... Billy slowly crosses toward Candy, stopping halfway to lo back at McMurphy, who gives him an affirmative gesture. H crosses to Candy, who just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-C-Candy, wu-wu-will y-y-you mu-mu marry me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Billy... Candy rises, kisses Billy on the cheek, and dances with h McMurphy beams on the twosome, unscrews his whiskey bottl takes a long pull on the juice, and looks at Bromden. Bromden sits by the window waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the MUSIC ENDS. A long silence, then another NUMBER be as McMurphy, who has nodded off, starts awake and looks around. McMURPHY'S POV Bromden sits by the window waiting. Cheswick is asleep on the table. Martini and Scanlon are sitting in their wheelchairs fill their cups from through the enema tube. Harding sits, maintaining his aloofness, smoking a cigare Sefelt is sitting on the floor, in a drunken stupor, whil Fredrickson dances around him. Candy and Billy stand, locked in each other's arms, swayi to the MUSIC. McMURPHY struggles to his feet, steadies himself, crosses to the nurses' station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy enters and goes to Turkle, who is dead asleep McMurphy lifts Turkle's keys and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy crosses to Billy and Candy, and gently partin them, he puts his arms around them -- as much for support affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you lovers, it's gettin' late... They move toward the hallway. Bromden and Harding are the only two who watch them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy passes several doors, reaches the door of his choice, fumbles with the keys, finds the right one, and o the door to the seclusion room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing aside) In ya go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back) M-M-M-Mack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, kid. Everything it going to be okay... I'll come back an' getcha in a while... 'Kay... Candy and Billy, hand in hand, enter the small room, whic has a bed in it. McMurphy closes the door, looks at the keys, and pockets them. CAMERA TRACKS with McMurphy, who is a very weary ma back into the day room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER LOUDSPEAKER as McMurphy crashes heavily into h chair. He can hardly keep his eyes open as he looks aroun Harding sits nearby. Taber is lying on a couch, his head in Rose's lap. Cheswick is asleep on the table. Ellis stands nailed to the wall. Bromden sits by the window -- waiting. CAMERA HOLDS on Bromden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Harding, wake me in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mack... CAMERA PUSHES INTO WINDOW. TIME LAPSE SHOT of the DAWN an SUN RISING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very far away; getting closer) Bibbit? Where's Bill Bibbit, ya damn goons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Washington jostles McMurphy awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get over there! McMurphy allows himself to be led to the heavy security partition, by the men's dorm, where all the patients are lined up. It is morning and the day room is a mess: A few chairs turned over. Paper cups and empty bottles. Puddles of cough syrup, orange juice and apple juice work into sticky masses. Rose sits by herself on the couch. Bromden is the last one led to the lineup, where Big Nurs waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mister Washington! Mister McMurphy, do you know where Billy is? McMurphy shrugs "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Harding, have you seen Billy? Harding shrugs "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Sefelt... Big Nurse's question is cut off as all the patients and attendants turn their heads toward the hallway and start laughing. Big Nurse turns to see Turkle, without his shir on, walk into the seclusion room and close the door behin him. Big Nurse turns and starts down the hallway, the laughter trailing after her when, suddenly, the laughter breaks of Big Nurse stops and in the silence, she opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Big Nurse opens the door to see Candy snuggled up to Billy, who lies there, eyes closed, a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (buttoning up his shirt) Morning, Miss Ratched... He slides out of the room as Billy opens his eyes. A long beat as they look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: M-M-M-M-M-M-
dialogues.text: Big Nurse shakes her head and exits, closing the door beh her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Big Nurse heads for the day room, walking straight for McMurphy when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) M-M-M-Miss Ratched! Big Nurse stops and turns to see Billy, half naked, pulli his pajama pants up as he runs, stumbling toward Big Nurs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying out as he runs) P-p-p-please du-du-don't t-t-t-tell m-m-my muh-muh-muh-mummy! He trips on his pajamas and falls sprawling at Big Nurse' feet, his bare ass exposed to all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blubbering as he rises) P-p-p-please du-du-du-don't t-t tell her, p-p-please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have thought about that before you brought that woman in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-n-n-n-no, no, I du-du-du-didn't, I didn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your mother to believe something like this but what am I to think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh-sh-sh-she m-m-made m-m-me do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, that girl couldn't have pulled you in there forcibly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sh-sh-she did! Everybody did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M-M-Muh-Muh-McMurphy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, Billy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (caught in his own anxiety) P-p-p-please duh-duh-duh-duh t-t tell, M-M-M-Miss R-R-Ratched, y-y you don't need to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) No! No! No! Billy pitches forward and collapses on the floor, screami pounding his fists and feet against the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N-n-n-n-duh-duh-duh-pl-pl-pl-pl-muh muh-muh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring McMurphy) Mister Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helplessly to Billy) Hey, Billy, stop cryin'. You don't have to cry... You ain't got nothin' to be ashamed of. She ain't gonna tell you mother... stop crying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Ratched!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Washington) Put him in Doctor Spivey's office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Miss Ratched... Washington nods to Warren and the two of them scoop Billy the floor and carry him screaming to Doctor Spivey's offi as Big Nurse crosses into the nurses' station and picks u the phone as Candy eases her way into the day room and jo McMurphy. A beat, then Miller starts herding the patients toward th washroom, staying clear of McMurphy and Bromden, who don' move. McMurphy pulls the keys out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Candy) Let's go! McMurphy checks the nurses' station, sees Big Nurse is bu on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bromden) Let's go, Chief... McMurphy crosses to the window, followed by Bromden, Cand and Rose, where he begins fumbling with the lock.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: as he herds the patients out of the day room. He turns to McMurphy trying to open the screen. Miller crosses to McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's gone here? McMurphy turns around and punches Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Big Nurse, still on the phone, sees Miller go sprawlin across the floor. She grabs the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through loudspeaker) Washington! Warren! To the day room, immediately!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy opens the screen, raises the window, and helps C and Rose out as Washington and Warren converge on them. McMurphy and Bromden wheel around. Washington, Warren and Miller appear around the corner, t one look, and head straight for McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping just short) 'Kay, let's have the keys an' nobody get hurt! Washington's words are cut off as, O.S., Nurse Pilbow SCREAMS... a bloodcurdling scream. They turn to see Nurse Pilbow enter the nurses' station, her uniform splattered blood, hysterically talking to Big Nurse (we can't hear h Big Nurse and Nurse Pilbow rush out of the nurses' statio and head down the hallway. McMurphy is glued to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling from outside) Come on, come on, let's go! McMurphy hesitates, then moves across the day room toward hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SHOOTING TOWARD the door, crammed full of patients who stare at the scene with curious detached looks, as Bi Nurse and Nurse Pilbow force their way through the patien The crowd parts and Big Nurse stops in the doorway, horri at what she sees. CAMERA HOLDS on Big Nurse's reaction. A beat, then McMurphy appears alongside Big Nurse and is stricken by what he sees. McMURPHY AND BIG NURSE'S POV - REVERSE SHOT - DOCTOR SPIV

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: The office is splattered with blood. Billy is lying face hanging over Spivey's desk, dead. His throat and both wri are cut. A broken picture frame, containing a photograph Spivey's family, lies nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, oh, Billy boy... McMurphy crosses into the room and kneels alongside Billy body. He gently lays his hand on Billy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from him! Don't you dare touch him! McMurphy turns and leaps at Big Nurse, grabbing her throa he drives her into the Acutes and Nurse Pilbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McMurphy, Big Nurse, Nurse Pilbow and several Acutes g down, arms and legs intertwined, kicking, trying to get a as McMurphy strangles Big Nurse. Nurse Pilbow screaming, as Washington, Warren, Miller rus in, trying to break his hold on Big Nurse's throat, her f turning blue. McMurphy's face, twisted by his passion, wh Washington lands a rabbit punch and MeMurphy's face relax as he passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC OVER LOUDSPEAKER. The day room is as it was in the beginning. Harding is dealing out a game of blackjack to Martini, Scanlon, Cheswick and Fredrickson. Taber, pencil in band, sits pondering over a blank sheet paper. Ruckly is turning a grimy photograph over in his hands. Bancini sits wagging his head, mumbling over and over, "Tired... awful tired..." Ellis stands against the wall, outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over last scene, in McMurphy's style) Okay, suckers, place your bets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bromden is mopping the floor near the security gate to th visitors' room, when a key hits the lock. Bromden looks u expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sefelt and Miller enter the visitors' room, cross to t security gate and pass into the hallway. Bromden goes bac his mopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sefelt jauntily enters the day room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through loudspeaker) Did everything go well, Mister Sefelt? Sefelt turns to the nurses' station where, inside, Big Nu sits very erect, wearing a back brace that reaches up aro her neck. Sefelt shows his teeth and gums to Big Nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through loudspeaker) That's very nice. Now, doesn't that make you feel better, Mister Sefelt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good... She turns back to her work. Sefelt crosses to the card game, where he sits and catche Fredrickson's attention; showing him his teeth. Fredricks smiles at Sefelt and blows him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (who has been dealing) Big Ace... a lovely lady... another ace... an' a little trey, hey, hey, whadaya say... hit or sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fredrickson) Ya know what, Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dealing a card to Scanlon) Big king, too bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait till you hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Blinker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary Blinker's fulla shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is! Harding slams his card down on the table, rises and cross to the nurses' station where he taps on the side window. Big Nurse gets up, crosses to the window and slides it op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mister Harding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Mister Harding, that is not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bromden is squatting, leaning against the wall near the security gate to the visitors' room, when a KEY HITS THE LOCK. He looks up expectantly. This time it is McMurphy. what was McMurphy, for his head is bandaged, and his tong hangs out of his mouth as he is led across the visitors' by an ATTENDANT. McMurphy shows Bromden no sign of recognition, which Brom pays no attention to, thinking McMurphy is putting on the same act he did when he came back from Electro-Shock Ther Bromden joyously turns and runs down the hallway to the d room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bromden crosses into the day room, gets a seat, and si facing the hallway, bursting with expectation. A long beat, then the Attendant appears with McMurphy and taps at the side door to the nurses' station. The Acutes break off their card game and look at McMurphy their faces hang open at his appearance. Big Nurse crosses to the side door, opens it, and steps o into the day room. To the Attendant as she takes McMurphy the arm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am... The Attendant exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to McMurphy) Now, let's find you a place to sit, shall we, Mister McMurphy? Big Nurse gently guides McMurphy to a seat on the Chronic side of the room. Bromden can hardly contain himself as he waits for McMurp to go into his act. The Acutes have already absorbed the reality of McMurphy' condition as they exchange looks with each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Lobotomy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that Gary Blinker is fulla shit... The Acutes turn back to their card game as Harding shuffl and deals the cards out. Bromden keeps his eyes glued to Big Nurse and McMurphy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting McMurphy down) Here now, you sit here... That's it... Big Nurse pats McMurphy's face and crosses back to the nurses' station. McMurphy just sits there, his head lolling to one side. Bromden waits for McMurphy to go into his routine. McMurphy just sits there. Bromden snaps his fingers and slaps his thigh, then waits McMurphy to follow suit. McMurphy just sits there slobbering. Bromden slaps his thigh again. No response from McMurphy. The MUSIC PLAYS ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bromden stands by the window looking out. A long beat, then he turns into the room and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients are all asleep. The new night attendant is f asleep in the nurses' station. Bromden quietly takes his pillow and goes to McMurphy's b where he kneels and puts his head very close to McMurphy' long beat as Bromden studies McMurphy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering in McMurphy's ear) When I first came here I was so scared of being lost I had to holler so they could track me... I figured anything was better than being lost... On the last word, Bromden places his pillow over McMurphy face and begins to suffocate him. McMurphy starts thrashi and Bromden lies full length on McMurphy. A long beat, th the thrashing ends. Bromden gets off McMurphy, replaces h pillow, and crosses down the aisle toward the day room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night attendant continues to sleep as Bromden passes nurses' station, heading for the tub room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bromden crosses to the heavy machine which McMurphy ha once tried to lift, sizes it up, then bends over and take hold and heaves. The GRINDING WEIGHT is HEARD as Bromden exerts all his strength, slowly lifts the machine off the floor, balances it above his shoulders, then crosses out the tub room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Bromden comes around the corner and past the sleeping night attendant in the nurses' station. Bromden lines himself up with the window across the room, then starts toward it, picking up speed as he goes. Then, the last moment, he stops and, with an enormous effort, h hurls the machine through the security screen and the win A LOUD CRASH. In the nurses' station, the night attendant starts awake looks around. Too late as Bromden vaults through the wind CAMERA HOLDS on window as Bromden runs across the grounds disappears into the pine trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the night attendant comes out of the nurses' station a looks confusedly around. Then he spots the shattered wind

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: Rolling hills, forests and distant mountains, bathed in sunlight, as Bromden runs across a far-off meadow. CREDITS OVER.
